task.title: Publishing to GitHub Using GitHub Actions
task.shortdesc: In this step, youâ€™ll learn how to publish your content.

context.p: This step will walk you through the process of publishing your content through GitHub Actions. This is the point where your work in Oxygen and GitHub truly merges into one single workflow.

step.cmd: Make Sure You Have a .ditamap File in Oxygen
step.info: This is necessary, as this is the file that GitHub will be trying to pull from. Name it "document.ditamap" to make sure it works.

step.cmd: Ensure that all changes made on Oxygen are committed.

substep.cmd: From the Oxygen personal workspace, go to "Changes" on the left sidebar.
Press the blue "Commit..." button, write a message briefly describing what you have changed, then confirm the commit.

step.cmd: Go to the GitHub repository and check to see if your deliverables are there!

substep.cmd: The PDF file should be found at the bottom of the most recent commit under GitHub Actions.
The HTML should be automatically uploaded to GitHub Pages, so go there to check (in Settings, then Pages).

step.cmd: If the HTML is not uploading automatically, then you must build it manually in GitHub Pages.
